txt.en: The South Gate has been cleared of Enemy forces. Use the banner to claim the Control Point.
'Skirmishes against the Enemy focus on taking and controlling locations of value and importance around the battlefield.'
'In reclaiming Bree, these locations are the South-gate, the Auction House, and Bill Ferny's home, in that order.'
'The gate is well-protected, but your Soldier will aid you in the battle. If he falls, simply call for another by re-using the skill you learned.'
'If not for my arm, I would be at your side as well. Now go and reclaim Bree.'

'I did not think help would get here this quickly, but I am grateful to see that it has. I am afraid the situation is currently not very good. Brigands, let in by Bill Ferny and Harry Goatleaf, have taken over much of Bree.'
'Your Soldier is a powerful ally in the fight against the encroaching darkness. He will aid you greatly in your battles against the Enemy.'
'You have done much good work here today, [placeholder]. There is more to do, but for today, let us rest and tend our wounds.'
'Go and rest. You have done much good for the world today. More will be needed tomorrow, but for tonight, enjoy the respite.'
'Good, now use your new skill and call forth a Soldier of the Free Peoples.'
'We have taken a foothold within the town and weakened the enemy, but I fear the fight here is not yet over. For now, take a respite. You have earned it.'
Using the horn has taught you the skill needed to call a Soldier into a Skirmish.
A Soldier of the Free Peoples appears to aid you in your Skirmish with the Enemy.
'A great war is beginning, and the battles to be fought will be great and perilous. You will not survive alone.'
The monsters at the South-gate have been cleared. Use the banner to claim the Control Point
'Fortunately, there are Soldiers of the Free Peoples willing to fight by your side. If you call them, they will aid you.'
<rgb=#00FF00>The South-gate of Bree has fallen to your control. The next valuable location is the Auction House just ahead</rgb>
'Use the horn here, learn the skill it possesses, then call forth a Soldier to aid you in retaking Bree.'
<rgb=#00FF00>You have taken control of the Auction House</rgb>
<rgb=#00FF00>Dríthlorz has been defeated and Bill Ferny's house is secured. Bree is not yet free, but much progress has been made</rgb>
'Good work. The south of Bree is once again free. There is more to do, but it can wait until tomorrow.'
Dríthlorz has been defeated and Bill Ferny's house is secured. Bree is not yet free, but much progress has been made.
While the Rangers of the North were distracted in the South, brigands and ruffians took an opportunity to wrest control of Bree....
Dríthlorz has been defeated and Bill Ferny's house is secured. Bree is not yet free, but much progress has been made.
'Very good, now let me share with you the plan of how you're going to reclaim Bree.'
'This isn't over yet!'
Take control of Bill Ferny's house and defeat Dríthlorz
<rgb=#00ffff>Encounter: A brigand is attempting to detonate several black powder casks at the stables</rgb>
Report your success to Second-watcher Heathstraw
Listen to Second-watcher Heathstraw
Talk to Second-watcher Heathstraw
Use the horn to learn how to call a Soldier
Use your new skill to call forth a Soldier
Listen to Second-watcher Heathstraw
Talk to Second-watcher Heathstraw
Take control of Bree's South-gate
Use the banner to claim the South-gate
Take control of Bree's Auction House
The Auction Hall has been cleared of Enemy forces. Use the banner to claim the Control Point.
Bill Ferny's House has been cleared of Enemy forces. Use the banner to claim the Control Point.
<rgb=#00ffff>Encounter Complete: Reginald Cutweed has been defeated and the building is safe</rgb>
Second-watcher Heathstraw is at his camp just outside of Bree's South-gate. He is waiting for you to report in.
The horn is on a crate next to Second-watcher Heathstraw. You will need to use it in order to learn how to call forth a Soldier into the battle.
The Soldier skill is in your Skill Panel under the Skirmish section. You will need to use this skill to summon a Soldier to aid you.
Second-watcher Heathstraw is at his camp just outside the South-gate of Bree. He wishes to discuss his plan for retaking the town with you.
The South-gate is just north of Second-watcher Heathstraw's camp. You will need to clear all of the enemies from around the banner in order to claim it.
The banner is at the South-gate of Bree. In order to claim this Control Point you need to use the banner.
The Auction House is north of the South-gate of Bree. The enemies must be cleared and the banner used to take this point.
Bill Ferny's house is east of the Auction House. Dríthlorz and his allies must be defeated and the banner used in order to reclaim this part of Bree.
Second-watcher Heathstraw is just outside of Bill Ferny's house. He wishes to discuss your victory with you.
'Bree belongs to the half-orc! The time of man is over!'
South-gate
Auction Hall
'Use the horn, and it will teach you how to call forth a Soldier to join you in your Skirmish against the enemy.'
<rgb=#00FF00>The counter-attack has been defeated. Bill Ferny's house may now be attacked</rgb>
'Use the skill the horn taught you to call forth a Soldier of the Free Peoples. You will not survive storming the gates of Bree alone.'
'The South-gate must be taken first. If it is not in our control, we cannot hope to push further into Bree.'
'Oftentimes, the enemy will not be pleased about losing a location of importance. Be wary...they may launch a counterassault to try and regain it.'
'The leaders of the enemy's forces are often cunning and powerful creatures. They should not be regarded lightly.'
'The leaders of the enemy's forces are often cunning and powerful creatures. They should not be regarded lightly.'
Tutorial: Thievery and Mischief
Bill Ferny's House
The South-gate of Bree is just outside Heathstraw's camp. To take control of it, all enemies surrounding it must be defeated
<rgb=#FF0000>A counterattack has been launched against the Auction House</rgb>
